title: Any refunds for the people who "basically" got scammed by Riot during Clash?
body:
I'm talking about the people who paid either Riot Points or Blue Essence for multiple tickets, only for the game mode to break on the first day. These tickets are un-refundable even though those players were unable to play due to mass client bugs.

~ First-day client bug prevents multiple teams to lock in properly (Addressed - and a later play time was set)

~ The second day had an Error bug whenever you tried subbing another player in... causing even more teams to drop.

Not really fun paying for something you don't receive...

replies.body:
Hey Resolution! Sorry you had a bad experience here. 

a) We resolved the lock-in issues after the first flight of day 1 with a bugfix to our store.
b) The "Unknown Error" for subbing another player was down to them being too high-tier for the player they were replacing; we've updated that tooltip already.

You should hit up [Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com) with all that info and they should be able to help.
Is this Clash thing not going to be a regular weekend event?

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qGozXOnI,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-16T17:57:07.009+0000)
>
> Is this Clash thing not going to be a regular weekend event?

The tickets they're using now were a placeholder; they're planning to use Premium tickets in its place later on. No guarantee the tickets from this weekend will be reusable since it's Beta.
